definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: But, if a man bites a dog, that might make front-page news.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果人咬了狗，那倒可能成爲頭版新聞。

sentences.english: This maiden voyage of Titanic must make headlines.
sentences.chinese: 泰坦尼克號的處女航必須成爲頭版頭條。

sentences.english: The report on this scandal appeared on the front-page of the Washington Post.
sentences.chinese: 這樁醜聞的報道出現在了《華盛頓郵報》的頭版。

sentences.english: It will be on the front pages of America’s newspapers the next morning.
sentences.chinese: 這將成爲美國衆多報紙翌日一早的頭版新聞。

sentences.english: Add a rolling slideshow on the frontpage with links.
sentences.chinese: 添加一個鏈接頭版上用滾動播放幻燈片。

sentences.english: The first edition or printing of a book is known as the princeps.
sentences.chinese: 一本書的第一版或首次印刷被稱爲頭版書。

sentences.english: In a front-page headline it said he was "a collector and a patriot".
sentences.chinese: 頭版的一個標題稱他是“收藏家和愛國者”。

sentences.english: The BZ carried the story on its front page with the headline: "Whoever sweats gets to go home."
sentences.chinese: BZ在頭版刊登了這則消息，標題是《熱了就回家》。

sentences.english: In Britain they are splashed across the front pages.
sentences.chinese: 而在英國，他們會刊登在報紙頭版的顯著位置。

sentences.english: The controversy put Carrey’s name in the headlines for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 而爭論使得凱利的大名首次登在頭版頭條。

sentences.english: This is the "Asahi Shimbun" reported 29 headlines.
sentences.chinese: 這是《朝日新聞》29日頭版頭條報道的。

sentences.english: Front page should have In this issue box.
sentences.chinese: 頭版應該在這個問題上框。

sentences.english: The figure, from the New York state comptroller, drew prominent news coverage.
sentences.chinese: 這個數字出自紐約州審計長，被報界登上了新聞頭版。

sentences.english: The chief editor decides which will be the most important story on the front page.
sentences.chinese: 隨後主編決定哪篇報道最重要，應安排在頭版。

sentences.english: The young player was on the front page of the sports section.
sentences.chinese: 這位年輕選手出現在體育欄的頭版。

sentences.english: The front page is devoted to the continuing saga of the hijack.
sentences.chinese: 頭版是對劫持事件的連續報道。

definition: to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
